step1.sentence: She decided to devote time to learning a new language after years of putting it off.

step2.story: After his promotion, Marcus realized he had been neglecting his family. He made a promise to devote time to his children every evening, no matter how busy work got. Within weeks, the dinner table was filled with laughter again.

step3.story: When Clara retired from her corporate job at fifty-five, she felt a strange emptiness. For decades, every hour had belonged to deadlines and meetings. One morning, she wandered into a community garden and watched an elderly man tend his tomato plants with quiet devotion. Inspired, she signed up for a plot of her own and began to devote time to growing vegetables from seed. The slow rhythm of watering, weeding, and waiting taught her a patience she never knew she lacked. By autumn, her small garden had become the most abundant patch in the whole community.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '시간을 바치다'라는 뜻으로, 특정 활동이나 목적에 시간을 할애한다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일에 의식적으로 시간을 투자하겠다는 결심이나 헌신을 표현할 때 사용합니다. 단순히 시간을 쓴다는 것보다 목적의식과 진지함이 담겨 있습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: devote는 라틴어 'devotare(맹세하여 바치다)'에서 유래했으며, 원래 종교적 헌신을 뜻했으나 현대에는 특정 대상에 전념한다는 일반적 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: spend time과 비슷하지만, devote time to는 더 강한 의지와 헌신의 뉘앙스를 담고 있어 격식 있는 표현입니다. 중요하다고 여기는 일에 시간을 쏟겠다는 진지한 태도가 느껴집니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He devotes time to volunteering at the shelter every weekend.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 매주 주말 보호소에서 봉사하는 데 시간을 헌신한다.
